text: I'm Brad and I can see the future bran
Stark was absent from season 5 of Game
of Thrones but we know he's going to
play an integral part in season 6 the
very first teaser trailer prominently
featured bran and his mentor bloodraven
the past is already written the only new
information we got was the two of them
speaking with each other probably about
their powers that they have which is
called green site green site is the
ability to see into the past present the
future sometimes green sears have dreams
as if they are other people experiencing
real events that have happened other
times it's sort of this symbolic imagery
that gets thrown at them and it's up to
the green Sears to interpret what it is
that's going on the only other greenseer
in the series was Jojen Reed who was
traveling with bran to find bloodraven
in season 4 unfortunately he got killed
off we know from the books that bran
uses his green sight to see the history
of Winterfell and he actually even
catches a glimpse of his father Ned from
way back in the day so the way that it
works is they actually see through the
eyes of the weirwood trees those are
those white skeletal looking trees with
red leaves and they all have faces
carved into them which is really crazy
cool so in the teaser trailer for season
6 there's a shot of Jon Snow leading out
and then it immediately cuts to brand
morning they have no idea what's going
to happen there seems to be a connection
between what happened to Jon Snow and
brands abilities at least that's what
the trailer was implying if bran knows
how to finally defeat the White Walkers
he might be able to somehow communicate
that information to John
brands lime they have no idea what's
going to happen seems to imply that he
does know the fate of all of Westeros
it'd be cool if you could pass that
information on to us
